intro: Naucleopsis concinna, commonly known as the small nauclea, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, deciduous leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a relatively rare and understudied species.
